channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2024040378
item.description:
Report X-2024040378

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-29
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Facer upstairs called for a leaking hazmat on the belt, QA admin went upstairs to retrieve it. Package was on automated roller line and was leaking. Package was taken off by QA admin and put into a lined tote. Management was informed that maintenance needed to oversee clean up of spill on conveyor system. Maintenance arrived and cleared spill area for sort to start back up again. DescribePack: Cap came loose during time in automatic sortation causing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately put into a lined tote once retrieved off of roller line and kept in an upright position till it could be taken back downstairs to be processed.

item.title: Report X-2024040706
item.description:
Report X-2024040706

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FIVE PACKAGES FROM HONG KONG SAR, CHINA TO THE USA WERE INSPECTED BY USA CUSTOMS OFFICIALS TO FIND ALL BOXES CONTAIN STRIKE ON BOX MATCHES. INVOICE DESCRIBES CONTENTS AS 12500 UNITS OF PLASTIC RODS. EACH BOX CONTAINS SMALL BOXES OF STRIKE ON BOX BLACK TIP MATCHES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES TO INDICATE DANGEROUS GOODS WERE BEING SHIPPED FROM HONG KONG. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS IN THE SHIPMENT ARE 1ZB87Y290408240204, 1ZB87Y290419997029, 1ZB87Y290405109013 AND 1ZB87Y290419048232. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM HONG KONG USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER B87Y29, CHINA DIGITAL CITY FORUM LIMITED - SH, 31-F FORTIS TOWER, WANCHAI HONG KONG SAR, CHINA.

item.title: Report E-2024040264
item.description:
Report E-2024040264

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 3, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of glycol ether was damaged and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from TPM Group (TPM) to remediate the impacted site. Crews transferred the remaining contents of the damaged tote into two (2) separate 275-gallon totes and label as "DO NOT DELIVER." TPM utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the impacted surfaces. All waste was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums and staged onsite with the damaged tote for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024040311
item.description:
Report X-2024040311

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat was discovered wet and the manager called QA. We treated the wet spot with neutralizer, secured the package and soiled clean up materials in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Caps became loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: we were called to the area of the incident when it accorded, we acted fast to clean up and contain the spillage. DescribePack: the cap on one of the bottles of cleaner had failed during transit. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the contents were put into a spill drum.
